data.title: Twitter, Elliott in deal for Dorsey to stay CEO and add directors
data.text: Twitter Inc  on Monday reached an agreement with Elliott Management that lets Jack Dorsey stay as chief executive and adds three new directors a few days after Elliott's plan to push out the social media company's chief became public.

data.title: MarketWatch First Take: Twitter is spending $2 billion to save Jack Dorsey’s part-time job — for now
data.text: Twitter Inc. reached an expensive compromise with activist investor Elliott Management on Monday to save Jack Dorsey’s part-time CEO job, but not for good.

data.title: Why Twitter’s Deal With Elliot Management Is Keeping It Afloat
data.text: Twitter Inc. (NYSE: TWTR) was one of the few stock actually making a positive move on Monday, despite the markets selling off in one of the worst trading days since the financial crisis.

data.title: Buy the Dip in These 7 Online Advertising Stocks Now
data.text: Online advertising stocks have sold off sharply in recent weeks on coronavirus fears. Here are 7 to put on your watch list.

data.title: Twitter Inks Agreement With Activist Investor and Silver Lake
data.text: Deal involves $1 billion investment.

data.title: Jack Dorsey to remain Twitter CEO after all
data.text: The company's co-founder was facing down an investor seeking to fire him.

data.title: Twitter, Elliott agree on board seats, Silver Lake investment
data.text: Twitter Inc  said on Monday that it will name three new directors to its board in an agreement with activist investor Elliott Management and private equity firm Silver Lake.

data.title: Twitter and activist investor agree on truce to keep Jack Dorsey as chief
data.text: Elliott Management, activist investor founded by billionaire Paul Singer, had purchased a $1bn stake in the company

data.title: Twitter Gets $1 Billion Investment That Will Keep Jack Dorsey As CEO
data.text: Jack Dorsey will see another day as Twitter CEO with Silver Lake’s lifeline.

data.title: Twitter Agrees To Changes Sought By Activist Investor Firm
data.text:
Twitter reached an agreement with a group of activist investors that have pressured the company to make changes, agreeing to a $2 billion share repurchase program, among other things.
The post Twitter Agrees To Changes Sought By Activist Investor Firm appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Twitter strikes deal with activist investor to keep Jack Dorsey on as CEO
data.text: Twitter announced a truce with billionaire Paul Singer’s hedge fund Elliott Management that will allow Jack Dorsey to remain chief executive, only a week after a report that the fund was looking to oust him. The Monday announcement also revealed that tech investing giant Silver Lake Partners would be making a $1 billion investment in.

data.title: Twitter Brings Swift End To Campaign To Oust Jack Dorsey
data.text: Elliott Management will get a board seat, and Twitter will buy back $2 billion in shares.

data.title: Twitter strikes deal with Elliott, Silver Lake
data.text: Twitter Inc  on Monday announced a deal with Elliott Management Corp, giving it a board seat just over a week after the activist hedge fund pushed for the removal of Chief Executive Officer Jack Dorsey.

data.title: Twitter In Peace Deal With Activist Investor Elliott Management: Jack Dorsey To Stay CEO, Silver Lake Invests $1B
data.text: Twitter said Monday it has entered into a cooperation agreement with Elliott Management, an activist investment firm that had been pressing for changes including the possible ouster of CEO Jack Dorsey. Dorsey will keep his job and Twitter today announced that investment firm Silver Lake, will make a $1 billion investment in the social media platform. Elliott owns

data.title: Jack Dorsey will remain Twitter's CEO after activist investor challenge
data.text: Jack Dorsey just survived a major threat to his leadership at Twitter.

data.title: Silver Lake makes $1B investment into Twitter; Twitter, Elliott call truce as Dorsey stays as CEO
data.text: After a week in which it looked like activist investor Elliott Management might try to force out Jack Dorsey as CEO of Twitter to help boost the social platform’s flagging growth, it looks like we have a truce of sorts between the two. Today, Twitter announced that it has received a $1 billion investment from […]

data.title: Twitter Reaches Deal with Activist Fund That Sought C.E.O.’s Ouster
data.text: Elliot Management had tried to oust C.E.O. Jack Dorsey after accumulating a stake in Twitter.

data.title: Twitter grants Elliott board seat, Silver Lake invests $1 billion
data.text: Twitter Inc  announced a deal with Elliott Management and private equity firm Silver Lake on Monday, handing both board seats after a month in which activist investors were said to be pushing for the removal of Chief Executive Officer Jack Dorsey.

data.title: Twitter strikes investment deal with Elliott Management, Silver Lake after attempt to oust CEO Jack Dorsey
data.text: The deal does not mention changes to Jack Dorsey's role as CEO.

data.title: Twitter to partner with Silver Lake, Elliott Management and conduct $2 billion in buybacks
data.text: Twitter Inc. TWTR, -4.31% announced Monday that it had struck a partnership with Silver Lake and Elliott Management Corp.
